alice.tucson.api

Class TucsonAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tucson.api.TucsonAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TucsonOperationCompletionListener, OperationCompletionListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Automaton

    public abstract class TucsonAgent
extends java.lang.Object
implements TucsonOperationCompletionListener
    Base class to extend to implement TuCSoN Agents. Once created, the method spawn() gets TuCSoN Default ACC (the most comprehensive at the moment) and trigger Agent's main execution cyle, that is the method main.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  TucsonAgent.AgentThread
      Internal Thread responsible for ACC acquisition and main cycle execution.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private TucsonAgentId aid 
      private EnhancedACC context 
      private java.lang.String node 
      private int port 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected TucsonAgent(java.lang.String aid)
      Same as before, this time using the passed String to create the TucsonAgentId from scratch
      protected TucsonAgent(java.lang.String aid, java.lang.String netid)
      Again we assume default port (which is 20504), so we skip that parameter (String aid version).
      protected TucsonAgent(java.lang.String aid, java.lang.String netid, int port)
      Same as first one, but takes a String in place of a TucsonAgentId that is created from scratch using such string.
      protected TucsonAgent(TucsonAgentId aid)
      Finally we assume both the default port and the default ip address (which is "localhost")
      protected TucsonAgent(TucsonAgentId aid, java.lang.String netid)
      Now we assume default port (which is 20504), so we skip that parameter.
      protected TucsonAgent(TucsonAgentId aid, java.lang.String netid, int port)
      Most complete constructor, allows to specify the ip address where the TuCSoN node to whom ask for an ACC resides and its listening port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TucsonAgent

        protected TucsonAgent(TucsonAgentId aid,
           java.lang.String netid,
           int port)
        Most complete constructor, allows to specify the ip address where the TuCSoN node to whom ask for an ACC resides and its listening port.
        Parameters:
        aid - The TucsonAgent Identifier
        netid - The ip address of the TuCSoN Node to contact
        port - The listening port of the TuCSoN Node to contact

      • TucsonAgent

        protected TucsonAgent(java.lang.String aid,
           java.lang.String netid,
           int port)
               throws TucsonInvalidAgentIdException
        Same as first one, but takes a String in place of a TucsonAgentId that is created from scratch using such string.
        Parameters:
        aid - The String to use to build the TucsonAgentIdentifier
        netid - The ip address of the TuCSoN Node to contact
        port - The listening port of the TuCSoN Node to contact
        Throws:
        TucsonInvalidAgentIdException

        netid - The ip address of the TuCSoN Node to contact

      • go

        public final void go()
        Starts main execution cycle main

      • main

        protected abstract void main()
        Main execution cycle, user-defined.

      • getTucsonAgentId

        public final TucsonAgentId getTucsonAgentId()
        Getter for the TucsonAgent identifier
        Returns:
        The TucsonAgentId for this agent

      • getContext

        protected EnhancedACC getContext()
        Getter for the ACC. At the moment the TucsonAgent base class always ask for the most comprehensive ACC (that is the DefaultACC): it's up to the user agent wether to use a more restrictive one (properly declaring its reference)
        Returns:
        The DefaultACC

      • setContext

        protected void setContext(EnhancedACC context)
        Setter for the ACC. Takes the most comprehensive one, hence even a less-powerful can be passed.
        Parameters:
        context - The ACC to use

      • operationCompleted

        public abstract void operationCompleted(ITucsonOperation op)
        Specified by:
        operationCompleted in interface TucsonOperationCompletionListener
